title: Vendor Risk Tiering
description: A simple logic-based assessment to determine whether a vendor should be classified as Low, Medium, or High risk.

data_type.text: What type of data will the vendor process or access?

criticality_low.text: Is the vendor involved in a business-critical function?

No.explanation: Vendor handles no personal/sensitive data and is not involved in a critical function. Low inherent risk.

Yes.explanation: Vendor handles no sensitive data but supports a business-critical function. Moderate inherent risk.

criticality_medium.text: Does the processing involve large-scale personal data?

No.explanation: Vendor processes personal data on a limited scale. Medium inherent risk.

criticality_high.text: Does the processing include special category data or legally regulated data?

Yes.explanation: Vendor handles highly sensitive or regulated data. Automatically high risk.

security_controls.text: Does the vendor have formal security controls (ISO 27001/SOC2/strong internal policies)?

Yes.explanation: Vendor handles elevated-risk data but has strong security measures. Medium tier with monitoring.

No.explanation: Vendor lacks adequate security controls for elevated-risk data. High tier.
